result.execSummary:
The defendant Robyn Kathleen Gravitter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant may not possess any alcohol.

No possession of illegal medications.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

Defendant must take all medication as prescribed and only in the manner in which they are prescribed.

Defendant must obtain/maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
Huber allowed consistent with jail rules.
Consecutive to: Jail time currently serving.
To be completed within first year of probation.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robyn Kathleen Gravitter in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Robyn Kathleen Gravitter in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:53 AM. Also called 15CF98. State - both matters are resolved. Scholke - 14CF130 - #1 - amend to 450.11(7)(h) - misd obtaining prescription by fraud - #2 - dismiss and read in - #3 - plead as alleged; 15CF98 - #1 - amend to 450.11(7)(h) - misd. obtaining prescription by fraud - #2 - plead as charged - #3 - dismissed and read in - #4 - amend to misd bail jumping; joint recommendation of 2 years probation with conditions of: fine of $100.00, AODA, absolute sobriety, no possession or alcohol or non-prescribed drugs, no enter into any bars or taverns, 50 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed, conditional jail is free to argue (State will be asking for 120 days) - credit for 14 days on 14CF130 and 7 days on 15CF98 (State stipulates to credit); State - makes correction on amendment and moves to amend as stated by Scholke. Court amends counts as previously stated. Scholke pleads NC to all counts stated in joint agreement by Scholke. Gravitter agrees. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Court reviews complaints. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - recommends 120 days of conditional jail. Scholke makes final argument prior to sentencing - run any jail time concurrent to the jail time she is sitting on a sanction (60 days). State changes his jail recommendation to 60 days - consecutive to the time she is serving now. Gravitter makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence on each count on each case, place on probation for 2 years on all counts - concurrent to each other, $100.00  fine plus costs on #1 in 14CF130 plus costs on all other counts, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no possession of illegal medications, 50 hours of community service - to be completed within first year of probation, 60 days conditional jail on count #1 on 14CF130 - huber allowed consistent with jail rules - consecutive to jail time she is currently serving, take all medication as prescribed and only in the manner in which they are prescribed, credit for 7 days on 15CF98 only if revoked and 14 days credit on 14CF130 only if revoked, right to appeal.
Final pre-trial at 08-25-2015 08:45 am

Defendant Robyn Kathleen Gravitter in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:03 AM. Court received notice that Mr. Roley is no longer on the case. Roley - was willing to proceed pro bono today but no resolution has been received, ready to hand over file to SPD. Court sets for another FPT, continues bond. Defendant to contact SPD.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Final pre-trial at 05-11-2015 08:45 am

Attorney Thomas Clinton Roley in court.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:15 PM. Roley - does not know where his client is, asks for 4 days to get a hold of her. State - asks for forfeiture of any bond posted and bench warrant, body or $1000.00 Court orders bench warrant, body or $1000.00. Recalled at 2:37 PM. Robyn Gravitter now appears in person and Attorney Roley appears telephonically with leave of the court. State - nothing to add. Court quashes warrant, set for another FPT on 5/11/15 at 8:45 AM.

#1 - lab results
Final pre-trial at 04-13-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant Robyn Kathleen Gravitter in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:04 AM. State calls Officer Bath. Bath sworn in at 9:05 AM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant. Cross exam by Roley at 9:13 AM. Re-direct by Simono. Simono offers exhibit #1 - drug test results. Court receives exhibit #1 after no objections (9:15 AM). Bath excused at 9:15 AM. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for trial, proceed to ARGN. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Roley has Information, waives reading, enters NG pleas on all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge - Copy given to JA
Preliminary hearing on January 22, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Called at 9:15 AM. Robyn Gravitter appears in person and with counsel Thomas Roley. State appears by Charles Simono. Roley has complaint as does Gravitter - waives reading, set for PH. Court continues bond, set for PH on 1/22/15 at 4:00 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 7, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Called at 10:25 AM. Robyn Gravitter appears in person and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. Gravitter informed Court off the record that she has Tom Roley - who was supposed to be in a JT today in Langlade County. Court not sure of whereabouts of Mr. Roley. Gravitter not sure why her attorney is not here today. Court continues bond, set for AIA on 1/7/15 at 9:15 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 10, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Called at 10:16 AM. Robyn Gravitter appears via video from FOSO and without counsel. State appears by JBC. Gravitter does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Gravitter understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, believes she has Tom Roley thru SPD. Court continues bond, set for AII on 12/3/14 at 9:00 AM. Gravitter asks for later court date as she will be entering Koinonia and will not be out of there until 12/5/14. Court continues bond and will set for AIA on 12/10/14 at 9:00 AM.
